headline: Easy Creamy Chicken Enchiladas
description: These creamy chicken enchiladas come together easily using shredded roast chicken, seasoning mix, and red enchilada sauce for a family-pleasing meal.
name: Easy Creamy Chicken Enchiladas
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) can Old El Paso® Red Enchilada Sauce
1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
10 Old El Paso® flour tortillas for soft tacos & fajitas (6 inch)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spread 1/4 cup of enchilada sauce in the bottom of the baking dish.

Mix chicken, 1 cup of Cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and seasoning mix in a medium bowl; spoon slightly less than 1/2 cup of filling onto each tortilla. Roll up each tortilla tightly; place seam-side down in the prepared baking dish. Drizzle with remaining enchilada sauce. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese on top; cover with foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes; uncover and bake 15 minutes longer or until bubbly and lightly browned.

review.reviewBody: I made the recipe as written. It was very easy to make but too cheesy. My daughter wouldn’t eat it. My husband didn’t like the cream cheese. He said that it was too overpowering and thought the enchiladas would be better if they were filled with chicken cheese and onions, only.

Such a simple recipe to make and cuts in half easily. I actually had the rotisserie chicken, tortillas, and enchilada sauce in the freezer and just happened to have half a block of cream cheese. So this recipe was perfect. I served it with Best Spanish Rice from this site.

I love this recipe. Quick and simple while still being tasty. I don’t like things too spicy so this is perfect for my family. I have found that using whipped cream cheese (sold in 8 oz packages) makes it easier to mix in.
I made it with corn and flour tortillas. I think I prefer the corn, but both were very nice!
Easy to put together and tastes great!
Made it with beef. Would recommend use of enchilada sauce.

Family night favorite. It’s a very flexible recipe that I’ve used with ground beef, leftover pork, or veggies. The cream cheese is the key. I’ve used velveeta instead and that worked pretty good but made it too salty in my opinion. Anyway, great basic recipe you can really build on or just keep simple.
Delicious, but needed more than 1/4 cup sauce in the pan. My enchiladas stuck!

I increased the recipe and added a can of Rotel (diced tomatoes with green chilis). I had to squeeze all the enchiladas into the 9x13, but they were so delicious (and I had enough to freeze for a couple more meals)!

First time in many, many years that I've made Enchiladas. I don't remember them being so easy. This was sooo easy and very good. I'll be making Enchiladas again. The cream cheese made them real creamy. but I did have some bigger chucks that didn't melt like I thought they should. Make sure to cut them up in small pieces or maybe even leave at room temp and stir it all together more.
Great, easy recipe that tastes great!

Waaaaay too salty with the packaged seasoning. Might be enjoyable with half the enchilada seasoning mix, and manually added cumin, and a bit of cayenne. As is, I feel like I wasted a chicken and ended up throwing half the pan away.

Good recipe and easy to make. I've never made Enchiladas before and I'm not sure I've ever had them before, but these are good.
I probably used a bit more cheddar than the recipe calls for, but my husband and I love cheese.
Really tasty! Made my own red enchilada sauce and fajita sauce from recipes on this site. My husband said best he has ever had!!

Made this true to the recipe, turned out very nice.
Topped with some salsa and green onion when serving.
Great recipe!!!
Delicious and easy to make. My family loved it.

This IS my go-to recipe! 
Easy. Delicious. 
My hubby loves them!
Very easy and delicious. The two of us had enough leftover for another meal.
I have made these several times. Sometimes I make my own red sauce.

So good and so easy! I cook the chicken breasts in a crockpot (chicken broth/water, salt, pepper, and garlic powder) so they’re super tender and shred easily. I add diced green chilies to the filling and I’ve used taco and fajita seasoning at different times. Both are great. Friends cleaned their plates, and said they were better than ones we get at our local Mexican restaurant!
Turned out great and the enchiladas were delicious!

This dish was excellent and the prep was easy!! My family loved it, even my pickiest little. I followed the recipe pretty closely, except I used Chi-Chi’s taco seasoning to season my chicken, which I warmed up on the stove. I then added half a packet of traditional Ortega taco seasoning to my chicken and cheese mixture for added flavor. I used corn tortillas instead of flour - I’m a traditionalist when it comes to tortillas for enchiladas. I think the texture is better for being baked. Overall, it was a hit and I will be using this recipe from now on!

The whole family loved it. The store did not have any rotisserie chickens available, so I put 3 chicken breasts in the crock pot with a little chicken broth (low for 4 hours), shredded the meat and used that instead. Other than that, made the recipe exactly as written and it turned out great. Very easy and delicious!
Easy and delicious!!!

This was AHHHH-MAZING! I made this for our SCHITT’s Creek premiere episode for final season and it was delicious! I did add 1 can of rotel and one small can of green chilies to recipe and it was wonderful! Will def do this recipe again! Fold in the cheese baby!
It was good. I added a 4 ounce can of chopped green chilies to the chicken mixture. Fajita seasoning mix too salty! Will try my own combination next time.
Loved this chicken enchilada recipe. So simple to make, yet delicious. The whole family enjoyed it!
Decided to try this recipe, Made exactly per the ingredients and directions. It turned out dry. Will stick to my own original dish.
Was very good but I made it for 10 enchiladas and added 16 oz of cream cheese like it called for. It turned out more like a chip dip which wasn't to bad. All and all it was a delicious recipe.
Quick easy dinner and oh so good! I served them over Mexican rice.
Delicious! Used taco seasoning because the store was out of fajita seasoning. Otherwise I followed the recipe exactly. Really good! My husband loved it too.
This was a good evening meal, could have served 6

Absolutely delicious! I added some canned black beans (rinsed) and about 1/2 cup salsa (pico de gallo) to the chicken mixture. After baking the enchiladas in the oven, I topped them off with some cilantro and a small dollop of sour cream before serving. I have made this several times and every time it gets great reviews from everyone. I will definitely be making this again!
I boiled 3 chicken breasts cut thin in chicken broth first and shredded with a fork. Added half a can of Rotel to the filling.

Loved this recipe! Adjusted a few things- when you are rolling the mix in the tortilla shell you can squeeze it together and form it into a log. the mix won’t fall out of the shell. I used a larger glass dish -10 x 15 to hold all of the shells- the 9x 13 was too small. The 6” shells seemed small but they can hold a lot of the chicken mixture. Observed it with Zararans

The outcome was not bad. I had to add some extra things. I poured a can of mild Rotel before backing on the first round..I added much more enchilada sauce what was originally stated. I used 2 of the 19oz old elapse enchilada sauce. It smells super delicious. I hope it tastes that good too.
I will not make this ever again. I am not sure if I what I did wrong, but this is NO way a 4-5 star recipe. I might give it a star.

I made the recipe as written. I would make it again. Next time I would put less cream cheese, cut up smaller to melt better. 10oz sauce was a little short. I served it with corn that could have been put into the mix instead of on the side.

I wanted something different so I made these. I did not buy cooked chicken so I cooked about 10 chicken tenders with 1T cumin, 1 can of mild Rotel, salt, pepper and 1T of minced garlic until the chicken was done. I shredded it and added the cheese, cream cheese, and a little taco seasoning, I didn't want to over season the mixture. Prepared them as directed. They were a hit. I will be making them again.
Made it with jalapeno cream cheese for a little extra spice! Really good dish!
I really loved these enchiladas. I used corn tortillas instead of flour. taste great!
This was great! Easy to make and delicious!
It was delicious but next time I will add more cream cheese because I had so much chicken. Very simple to make! The bf loved it and we have plenty of leftovers.
I have made these in both beef and chicken just modified the recipe slightly but after making the recipe from Allrecipes
sickening amount of cream cheese, will try again with half the amount.
For the most part I followed the recipe but switched Mole Sauce for the Enchilada sauce. It was creamy and delicious and easy to make.

Filling is a bit mushy, but delicious.
I defrosted chicken tenderloins (10-12), then cooked them in my slow cooker with a taco seasoning packet and 1 can of chicken broth, on high for 5 hours.
Scooped chicken out of broth and shredded. 
Added to ROOM TEMPERATURE 8 oz cream cheese and diced scallions (saved some green parts for top with sliced black olives). 
Rolled inside 10 corn tortillas, covered with enchilada sauce, and 8 oz. shredded sharp cheddar, scallions and sliced black olives.

So my husband LOVED this!!! So yay! I, however, can’t do the globs of cream cheese in random bites. So next time I will try to use room temperature/softened cream cheese to spread on the tortillas. I used a whole package of taco seasoning instead of fajita or directed amount and that was good. Will be making again for sure with modifications. BUT SO SO easy!
I didn’t like these at all. Much to creamy and I didn’t like the flavor
I followed the recipe exactly as it was written and it was a huge hit!! definitely making again!
I will make this again. family hit .

This is now a house favorite with my whole family. You can double...triple this recipe. I made it for teacher appreciation to feed over 50 people with. They all LOVED IT! I Highly recommend this recipe!
It’s a great recipe, I added extra cheese and enchilada sauce! It’s a show killah!
Will make again. Added very thinly sliced onion and a small can of green chilies.
Loved it! I garnished it with diced tomatoes, cilantro, sour cream and salsa. My husband loved it too!!

Absolutely delicious! My fiancé won’t get enchiladas at the local Mexican restaurants because he likes these better. No substitutions needed, but I did decrease the uncovered cook time by 5 minutes To keep the top from getting too crispy. Heed the note to cube the cream cheese; it makes it a lot easier to mix the filling. Great recipe!
I'm a busy person who works long days. this recipe was amazingly delicious and better yet easy. I used slightly less cream cheese than what It called for. my wife loved them!!
I followed the recipe with no changes made and it was delicious!

I’ve made these several times for my family and they are always delicious! Even though I hate it when the recipe is altered :o), I do add a couple of things to the chicken mixture that really add to the flavor... I stir in a can of Rotel tomatoes with green chilis and a can of well drained black beans. I spoon the mixture into the tortillas and follow the rest of the instructions for cooking.
This is the easiest and best enchilada recipe! I substitute taco seasoning, and shredded chicken breast instead of rotisserie.

Love this recipe! It was my first time to make enchiladas. I was cooking rice as a side. After I made the rice I mixed in some of the enchilada sauce. Then layered it on the bottom of my sprayed pan. Then I decided to add fresh chopped spinach to the chicken mixture bc I was trying to use up what I had before it went bad. I had extra filling left over so I put it on top with the enchilada sauce and cheese. It turned out great! My family loved it! I will be making this again in the future!
I made my own enchilada sauce but other than that followed the recipe. Really tasty and simple.

This is an excellent recipe! I am sure it is the way it is written, but we made some changes. We used 8" tortillas, used a little more chicken and added refried beans. I am sure we messed up the nutrition value, but it sure was good!
I made this dish for the first time and everybody loved it, even my picky eater. I was amazed. I will make this again.

This was perfect ! My first time actually making enchiladas and the rotisserie chicken was such a good idea instead of the time it takes to cook and season it myself. The store I was at didn't have canned green chiles but they had diced tomatoes with green chiles so I used that and it still came out excellent.
Tastes great!
These are a hit every time I make them!

I just made this recipe for the first time tonight. Only thing different I did was cream the fajita spices with the cream cheese and added the enchilada sauce to it. Turned out perfect! Definitely going into my recipe rotation.

A big hit in my house. I substituted the Enchilada sauce for medium salsa and the Fajita seasoning for Taco seasoning. I will make it again and may use hot salsa or add in some jalapenos for an extra kick.

This has made it into my recipe book.
Excellent enchiladas-rich and creamy. Only change I made was to mix 8 oz can of tomato sauce with enchilada sauce to cover enchiladas. Will definitely make this recipe again!
Even though I would add a little less cream cheese next time, I think this recipe is really yummy! Great with rice and a bed of lettuce. Plenty enough for leftovers/freezer meals. Will make again.

I made a lot of changes but this recipe gave me the confidence to make enchiladas for the first time. I used hatch green enchilada sauce because I like it better with chicken than red sauce and I used corn tortillas because I like them better than flour tortillas. I had leftover baked chicken so I shredded it instead of buying a rotisserie chicken. Also, I didn't see the footnote about freezing the cream cheese so I melted it into my green sauce when I couldn't get it to cooperate - ha! I will definitely make this again!
I'm not a very good cook but surprised

I have made these before using the Costco rotisserie chicken and the described recipe ingredients. It is fast and easy and the kids, who are finicky enough, actually enjoy them and beg for more. I used Fronterra mild enchilada red sauce this time, but have used El Paso and Las Palmas and have found I prefer the Fronterra sauce the best. Add a little chopped onion, red and green peppers sprinkled with minced garlic and topped off with some some sour cream and you have a the makings of a delish Mexican dish!
Delicious!!!

We all loved it! And so easy. I hate to cook but my kids hate fast food. Typically I make seven meals on Sunday (eat one and freeze the rest) so that are freezer is always full of homemade dinner. This will definitely be making it into the rotation!
I substituted 3-4 chicken breast, sautéed in butter, with a little paprika and mixed with the other ingredients. I added sour cream and Frank’s RedHot for taste...sooo good!!!

I used a baked chicken breast instead of the rotisserie chicken. Other than that I went right by the recipe. Be sure to freeze the cream cheese for a bit before you cut it into cubes. Simple and delicious.
Stuck to the pan even though I had sprayed liberally with Pam. Thinking of using a different tortilla next time.
My family love it.

This recipe is so awesome and easy. Especially great way to use leftover chicken. I had corn tortillas so I used those instead of flour. It was great. I topped with sour cream and lettuce. I think I might add corn for a little more crunch.
I modify a little. I add mild green chilies to the chicken mixture, and only use a LITTLE bit of enchilada sauce brushed on top because My husband doesn't like it. But they are sooo good this way!!!

Sooo good! I substituted the chicken with Morning Star vegetarian "chicken" patties which I cut up into cubes before mixing with the cheddar and cream. ??????? Everything still came out perfect even with the change.
I used taco seasoning instead, added a lot more sauce and it was perfect.

i served it with a Red Enchilada Sauce found on allrecipes.com
AwEsOmE!!
It was good, I just used the taco powder and the enchilada sauce, instead of the cream cheese. Pretty basic, and turned out just as tasty!

Our 12 year old made this with only some help. It turned out really good! We are all in food coma mode. I like how simple it is, great for those just starting to cook on their own. We baked 2 (flattened) chicken breasts at 400 for 28 min instead of using rotisserie chicken.
Excellent! My whole family loved it!

This is a keeper. I had lots of time so I cooked 4 large skinless chicken breasts in a slow cooker with 8oz can of diced tomato, a medium white onion (diced), and a quarter of a small red onion (diced) together in a slow cooker on low for 6 hours. Shredded the chicken and added the resulting salsa to the mixture along with half of the taco seasoning mix.
The rest was exactly as specified in the recipe.
Delicious! Everyone loved it.
Great and easy to make added more of the fajita seasoning for our taste.

this was my first time making enchiladas, but the recipe turned out great and the family loved it! the only changes i made was that couldn't find enchiladas sauce so i used taco sauce and i used a nacho cheese blend which gave the enchiladas a little more of a spicier kick. which i loved!

I put the chicken mix in the crock pot for the day to cook - came home and assembled in a casserole dish with the sauce and more cheese - baked for 30 minutes. Delicious and beautiful on the table! Used taco seasoning instead of the fajita seasoning because it's what I had - added black beans with the chicken and a can of green chiles for some spice. Shout out to Selina, my sous-chef who assembled and baked these for us! :) The only hitch we had in the dish was forgetting to put sauce in the pan before the tortillas - the bottom layer was baked on pretty hard - still looked and tasted delicious and we will make again!

I loved this recipe! I substituted leftover gravy for the flour & broth and it turned out wonderful! I had sauce leftover after assembling the recipe so I added salsa to it & served it as dipping sauce. I give this recipe 5 stars!
I thought the cream cheese was not a tasteful ingredient. Maybe refried beans could be substituted for it. In any case, I won't make this recipe again. A very heavy, unpalatable dish. Sorry.
Made this for dinner it was delicious and a big hit. I tweeted it a little by adding sliced black olives small can and a small can of green chilies, drained. And... a scoop of sour cream.

I didn't have cream cheese, so I used ricotta cheese which was in the fridge. A bog of Frontera red chile enchilada sauce was not as hot as Old Elpaso mild red enchilada sauce and was better suited to my family's taste buds. I will make this again!
I like this recipe. I used my own taco seasoning and also used corn tortillas for half of the enchiladas. I prefer the corn tortilla enchilada. Overall, this was a good recipe.
I used Mexican Fresco cheese in place of the cream cheese for a truer SW taste. Will definitely make these again.
